table.docs: This class provides a dynamic host list based on current host properties(user, memory, mhz, etc).
table.name: DynamicHostGroup

column.docs: Timestamp of last time puppet ran on this host
column.name: puppetPulse

table.docs:
@brief Job is the base table that represents an Assburner Job.
This table stores the type of job, the state and progress of the job, who submitted the job, who to notify regarding changes in the job, etc.
table.name: Job

column.docs:
@brief Represents all the users to notify regarding job errors, and how to notify them Format of the string is (USERNAME:[je]+),... USERNAME must be a valid name stored in the usr table. j - Sends notifications as jabbers e - Sends notifications as emails
Examples 'newellm:j,abe:e,diego:je' Sends jabber to newellm, email to abe, and both to diego.
column.name: notifyOnError

column.docs: @brief Represents all the users to notify regarding successful job completion, and how to notify them. See notifyOnError documentation for formatting details.
column.name: notifyOnComplete

column.docs: Maximum amount of time to load the job before a task is started. If a task hasn't started by the time this expires, the job will report an error and the host will be reset.
column.name: maxloadtime

column.docs: Maximum amount of memory a job is allowed to use (in bytes). If it exceeds this the task will raise an error.
column.name: maxMemory

column.docs: 0 - No Copy 1 - Copy to missing in-between frames 2 - Copy to all in-between frames 3 - Frame Fill Mode, renders in-between frames only
column.name: frameNthMode

column.docs: launch the render using 'n' threads
column.name: threads

column.docs: launch the render using 'n' processes
column.name: processes

column.docs: use 'script' to start renders
column.name: jobscript

column.docs: passes 'p' as the first parameter of script
column.name: jobscriptparam

table.docs: Represents a "canned" batch job, that can be submitted as a batch job at any time by just selecting the hosts to run it on.
table.name: JobCannedBatch

table.docs: Each packet assigned to a host will generate a JobCommandHistory. This stores the command executed, stdout, stderr, and peak memory.
table.name: JobCommandHistory

column.docs: This corrosponds to the MaxOpenExr enum, not the actual bit depth. Values are 0 - "Integer - 8 bits per channel" 1 - "Half Float - 16 bits per channel" 2 - "Float - 32 bits per channel"
column.name: exrSaveBitDepth

table.docs: @brief A container class to be subclassed for specific versions of Maya and MentalRay for Maya.
table.name: JobMaya

table.docs: JobService is a mapping table between jobs and any @ref Service they require on hosts to run them. A job can have multiple Service dependancies to support multiple plugin licenses, difference in machine builds etc.
table.name: JobService

column.docs: Average memory used per task in kilobytes.
column.name: averageMemory

column.docs: This holds the name of the task to be displayed to the user. If label is null, the task is considered to represent a frame and the number stored in the jobtask(frameNumber) field is displayed.
column.name: label

column.docs: Valid values are default - Default Scanline ogl - OpenGL scanline rapid - Rapid scanline, designed for very large scenes trace - Raytrace
column.name: renderer

column.docs: This holds the datetime when the notification was delivered to this destination. If this field is null, the notification has not been delivered.
column.name: delivered

column.docs: This is a generic field, can be used to hold email address, phone number, jabber id, etc.
column.name: destination

column.docs: Specifies the user that is being notified by this destination. Can be null if a user does not apply, or does not exist.
column.name: fkeyUser

column.docs:
This is a string encoded as follows
[SECTION],...
each section consists of:
ACTION:METHOD[:DESTINATION][:USER]
Actions consist of:
default - Sets default method/destination, user is ignored, only used for routing notificationdestinations. add - Adds a new destination using method/destination/user
Section Examples:
default:email - Sets default method to email add:email:gates@microsoft.com - Adds new destination, emails to gates@microsoft.com address
column.name: actions

column.docs: Routes are processes from lowest to highest priority. The default method can be set multiple times, so the highest priority is ultimatly used.
column.name: priority

table.docs: Used to associate a path with an asset, so that an asset can have multiple paths associated with it.
table.name: PathTracker

column.docs: comma seperated list of process names that can't be running for AB to start up, or pick up a job.
column.name: forbiddenProcesses

column.docs: This describes if the service is and active or passive service. Active services are running and are expected to pulse.
column.name: active

column.docs: This describes if this service should only be enabled on a single host at any given time.
column.name: unique
